articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hundreds queued on Tuesday outside a Hong Kong court ahead of the sentencing of 45 pro-democracy activists in a landmark national security trial that has damaged the city's once feisty pro-democracy movement and drawn international criticism.
articles.title: Hundreds queue for sentencing of 47 Hong Kong democrats

articles.author: Jake Spring, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies meet on Tuesday to discuss sustainable development and the transition to cleaner energy, as they aim to increase the odds of a successful deal to address global warming at U.N. climate talks in Azerbaijan.
articles.title: G20 leaders turn focus to climate change on Rio summit's last day

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: A top Ukrainian diplomat warned against any appeasement of Russian President Vladimir Putin, saying that the latest deadly attacks on Ukraine showed he had no desire for peace, and asked allies for further help.
articles.title: Ukraine envoy warns against 'appeasement' of Putin as war drags on

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Residents in India's northern states woke up to another day of poor air quality on Tuesday, as a layer of dense fog shrouded most of the region, and pollution in the capital Delhi remained severe.
articles.title: Toxic smog persists over India's north; Delhi pollution remains severe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: United States Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said on Tuesday the Mutual Defense Treaty between Washington and Manila applies to armed attack in the South China Sea.
articles.title: U.S. defence chief says treaty with Philippines covers armed attacks in South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. envoy Amos Hochstein landed in Beirut on Tuesday for talks with officials on a truce between armed group Hezbollah and Israel, Lebanon's state news agency said, hours after a proposal drafted by Washington won a nod from the Iran-backed group.
articles.title: US envoy in Beirut for talks after Lebanon, Hezbollah approve truce draft

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday approved an updated nuclear doctrine, saying that Russia could consider using nuclear weapons if it was subject to a conventional missile assault on it supported by a nuclear power.
articles.title: Putin issues warning to US with new nuclear doctrine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Over 200 children have been killed and 1,100 injured in Lebanon in the past two months, a spokesperson for the U.N. children's agency (UNICEF) said on Tuesday.
articles.title: More than 200 children killed in Lebanon in past two months, UNICEF says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of North Korean troops stationed inside Russia could grow to 100,000, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says North Korean troop contingent in Russia could grow to 100,000

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Argentina has notified the U.N. peacekeeping mission in Lebanon that it is withdrawing three of its officers, a UNIFIL spokesperson confirmed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Argentina withdraws three officers from UN peacekeeping mission in Lebanon
